title: Why do stars appear as points to us? - Quora

response.answer_text: This cames down to the fact that the further away something is the smaller it appears to be. When an object reaches beyond our normal visual limitations we can not see the object directly, but we can sense in our eyes some of the intense light being emitted from the stars. By using special equipment like a telescope the star can be made to appear a lot closer therefore will appear to be more than just a point.

Actually stars are not point and they dont twinkle.As the light from each star should tarvel through number of atmospheric layers where it undergoes bends(refraction)many times.This random bends results in the star twinking out which appears as twinkling and as a point.
